This is information from Mundi:
History
Mundi was the first isola to succeed at interisolary travel[1] through the pale during the Interisolary Age,[2] quickly becoming a geopolitical superpower that colonized five of the seven isolas[3] under the reign of Irene La Navigateur, Queen of Suresne (modern day Sur-la-Clef). Eight expeditions were sent out into the pale; five disappeared entirely, while two returned, but had lost their minds due to the effects of the pale. This is thought to have been a cruel attempt to purge the queen's political rivals, admirals who would have led the teams into the pale, which was thought to be inpenetrable.[4] However, the eighth and final expedition returned, and had managed to discover a new continent; Insulinde. At this time, Dolores Dei was councillor to the queen.[5]

Mundi is known as the "Old Old World".[6][7] In the Dolorian era, the three Crown Cities of the Mundi isola were Deora, Rheasilvia and Advesperascit.[8]

Geography
Mundi is the largest of the seven isolas,[9] located to the north of Insulinde.[10] The majority of the nations on the isola are a part of the EPIS-aligned Occidental sub-continent,[11] and include the Republics[12] of Vesper,[13] Messina,[13] Oranje,[14] Sur-la-Clef,[15] Meteo,[16] Königstein,[17] Gottwald,[18][19] and the island of Ubi Sunt?.[20] The remaining non-Occidental nations include Kedra[21] (which has been a candidate member since '21),[22] Saramiriza,[13] Mesque,[13] and Sao.[13] During the Dolorian era, there were fourty Mondial nations, half of which rejected Dolores Dei's rule.[23]

Corpus Mundi, a dormant volcano[24] holds the title of Elysium's highest point at 18.9 kilometres tall.[25] It is located on the Mundi isola, most likely in the Republic of Mesque. Mountaineer Cornelius Gurdi attempted to climb the mountain, but never returned,[26] though he is remembered as a national hero and is often associated with mountain goats -- the only creature fearless and agile enough to climb the mountain.[27]

Occident
The Occident is a sub-continent[11] on the Mundi isola, located to the south of Kedra.[28] It consists of EPIS-aligned nations, with Sur-la-Clef as its "executive heart".[29] Notable geographic locations include Irmala, a plateau where the vast majority of the world's supply of cocaine is produced, typically by slave labour,[30] and the Staadskanaal, an artificial channel through the Occident that is connected to the Preto Grande.[31]

Vesper
The Republic of Vesper, formerly a part of the Republic of Vesper-Messina, is an Occidental nation[32] on the Mundi isola.[33] It is situated partially on a peninsula on the southeast of the Occident and is close in proximity to the pale.

Vesper is a constitutional monarchy,[32] and a member of the Moralintern as well as the Coalition of Nations.[34] Its Department of Justice has published a paper on criminal profiling in former socialist states.[35] Systems analysts from Vesper have analyzed and expressed worries about the collapse of the Revacholian Zone of Control.[36] Its coat of arms is a lion and ostrich sitting upright.[37]

The Harmon Wowshi W02 is manufactured in Vesper, but designed in Seol,[38] and Averro, SRL, a chain of high-end pharmacies is found only in Vesper and Messina.[39]

The Dick Mullen series, as well as its titular character are both Vespertine,[40] and the nation is generally known for its police and spy novels,[41] influencing the RCM's aesthetic and culture as a result.[42] The Antistar was a Vespertine rock star famous for shooting morphine into one eyeball, and cocaine into the other.[43] He would later die as a result of his drug use.[44]

The Franconigerian boiadero culture adopted by Call Me Mañana is an appropriation of "Vespertine cool".[45] Vespertine proto-expressionism is a major artistic movement from the last century.[46]


Messina
The Republic of Messina, formerly the Republic of Vesper-Messina, was once a dual kingdom on the south-eastern coast of the Occident. It used to take up most of the peninsula, before separating into the Republics of Vesper and Messina. An amicable parting of ways produced two constitutional monarchies.

Mesque and Messina share a border.[47]

Oranje
An Oranje passport.
The Sovereign Republic of Oranje (O-RAN-yeh) or Oranjenrijk is a democratic nation on the Mundi isola, north of Insulinde, over the sea and across the pale.

Oranje is one of the six major Occidental nations to hold stake in the continued occupation of Revachol (the Coalition). People consider it a reasonable superpower.

Much of its influence is derived from its alignment with Moralintern and participation in EPIS, where it contributes 28% of the organization's annual budget and takes care of the political side of things. Next to Sur-la-Clef, Oranje is probably the most prominent member of the international community.[48]

Oranje's economy is one of the most advanced in the world. It has successfully transitioned from heavy industry to advanced services, and generally acts as an engine for sustainable change in the international community.

Numerous customs are characteristic of Oranje. For example, the Oranjese Map of the Waterways. It is a sailor's tattoo worn by wayfarers of the Dolorian century, over 300 years ago. The sailors would mark their bodies to map their travels. As technology developed and evolved, the tattoo was slowly abandoned by sailors and adopted by mercenaries, as a way to showcase their military careers. Vredefort, the capital of the Oranjese state, is traditionally placed on the right shoulder as the origin point.

In some municipalities of Oranje, people do wear shoes made of wood to street parades. Green, orange, and even yellow tassels have also been seen on hats.

Lelystad municipality has few boroughs and even fewer cities – it's made of agricultural plots near the border of Gottwald. Executive summary: cows, silos, and wheat.[49]
Vredefort is the capital of Oranjenrijk, known for its parks, glass, duraluminium - a conference city.[50] It's known for its Ijsbrand Military Academy.[51]
Oranjese special forces are notorious for their prowess and lethality. Private military contractors are also common: One of the more infamous is the Corps de Pharmacie, a security firm contracted to protect the interests of Oranjese pharmaceutical companies in the Semenine conflict.

Gottwald and Oranje share a border.[52]

Sur-la-Clef
Sur-la-Clef, formerly known as the Kingdom of Suresne, is an Occidental country[53] on the Mundi isola. had a long and storied role in the history of the world. It is here that Innocence Dolores Dei came to power as the chief advisor to Queen Irene the Navigator[54]. Sur-La-Clef was also responsible for opening the Insulindian archipelago for colonization, three hundred years ago, and was the original owner of the city of Revachol. By the Current Century, it's a modern, urbanized country ranking high on the Human Development and Freedom index, a leading member of the Coalition, and the executive heart of EPIS.

Sur-la-Clef is one of the founding members of and hosts the headquarters of the major EPIS institutions. The nation focuses on the business side of things.[55]

Meat balls and mashed potatoes are popular dishes in Sur-La-Clef. It's also popular in some parts of Revachol, primarily those with stronger ties to its original colonizing power.

Meteo
Meteo is a country on the Mundi isola.[56] It is one of the poorest first world nations today, but was once an ancient civilization.[57] Its capital city is Thylakos-by-Pisantic.[57] It is located near the Pisantic sea.[58]

The Meteoran name for the Founding Party is Ecclesiastes.[59]

Königstein
Königstein (lit. Kingstone) is a country on the Mundi isola.[60] It is located in the central Occident.[61] It is a rich country[62] known for it's contributions to psychology in the Thirties.[63] The Dominion Police of Königstein are a mounted police force known for their distinctive uniform of scarlet breeches and cylindrical fur caps.[61] Feld Electrical started as a midway electronics outfit in Königstein two centuries ago[64] and the now defunct lift company Halter was from Königstein.[65]

Königstein is located in central Occident.

Gottwald
Gottwald is a nation on the Occidental subcontinent of the Mundi isola, bordering Oranje.[66]

People from Gottwald are referred to as Gottwaldians or Gottwalders, or, derogatorily, Maun.[67] There is a Gottwaldian ambassador in Revachol.[68] Gottwald was a participant in the colonization of Iilmaraa.[69]

The language spoken in Gottwald is Walder. The accent is guttural and similar to an Oranjese accent.[70]

Gottwald is known for its industry. Companies and products from Gottwald include:

Schneller, a fashionable stationary brand popular with architects and engineers[71]
Mauer-Koshlai Mercury Group, a Gottwaldian-Iilmaraan mercury extraction company[72]
Kristallsprach Model 9, a specialist radio transceiver[73]
Villiers & La Salle, one of the original 14 indotribes, was acquired by Gottwalders after the Revolution.[74]

Gottwald has a prestigious award for youth literature, the Kritikerpreis.[75]

Gottwald is the source of one of the two major strands of post-Revolution communist thought, the Gottwald School. Gottwaldian critical theory posits that intellectuals are a class incapable of performing revolutionary change, only capable of inspiring it in others through critique,[76] and is incompatible with infra-materialism.[77] They also seem to develop extensive psychological analysis.[78]

A last-century Gottwaldian philosopher coined the term “life-world,” referring to things that share in human history.[79][80]

Knut Schmelling and Jörgen Stirneman, legendary pinball players who have managed sub-twenty minute runs on Gurdi's Goats.[81]
Moritz Metzger, a children's book author and illustrator who won the Kritikerpreis in '26 for his book The Saddest Pig in the World.[75]
Dr. Uwe Plattenkalk, an explorer and naturalist who claims to have sighted the eight-eyed teratorn in '21 while in Iilmaraa.[82]
Ubi Sunt?
[83]

Mesque
The Republic of Mesque[84] is the world's largest state by territory.[85] Magritte is a river in the great steppes of northern Mesque.[86] Villalobos is a peninsula on Mesque.[87] The dormant shield volcano Corpus Mundi, that stands as the world's highest summit at 18.9 km, is likely located on Mundi given the name.[88]


A rooster, commonly associated with Mesque.

The Confederate Republic of Mesque is a nation on the isola of Mundi. It is the world's largest state by territory. It is a confederation, petrostate, and a constitutional monarchy that has been experiencing a far-right shift in recent years, leading to isolation.[89]

Mesque has a long and complex history, tied closely to the Innocences. Franconegro, for example, is considered by many a father figure due to his militarism and nationalism. However, all things change: 300 years ago, the lands of Mesque and the Occident and even far-away Supramundi -- altogether twenty one of the forty Mondial nations of the time -- immediately accepted innocentic rule of Dolores Dei, even before her crowning. However, Dei's policies proved to be unpopular and eventually, the Mesque state tried to detach itself from innocentic rule. Parts of the world were experiencing whiplash from accelerating into secularism. Her mandatory education programs and mass resettlement of upstream Magritte were problematic as well. Dissenters were suppressed by a military force she called The Army of Humanity, leading to some modern thinkers condemning her treatment of Mesque reprehensible, and the many campaigns waged against it war crimes.[90][91][92]

The Mesque state seems to have reconciled its differences, as it was one of the members of the Coalition of Nations involved in pacifying the Antecentennial Revolution in Revachol. Occidental and Mesquite falangues - volunteers - were particularly infamous for their conduct in combat and bloodthirst.[93] To add insult to injury, the Mesque state was experiencing a golden age.[94] Fifty years on, Mesque is struggling: The golden age is over and the petrofascists are reigning supreme, isolating the nation on the interisolar stage.[95]

Marietti is a Mesque style of music and dance commonly seen at all manner of festivities -- especially weddings. It's delightfully quaint, owing to its peasant origins.[96]

Common Mesque legends are tied to Cornelius Gurdi, and his attempt to scale the world's highest peak, Corpus Mundi. National legend claims that Gurdi will return when Mesque is in danger, in order to save his people.[97]

Kedra
Kedra is a large nation in the mid-northern area of the Mundi isola, north of the Occident, between the Irmalan mountain range and the Pisantic *mare interregnum*.[28] It is notable for Stepan the Despicable, who defeated and humiliated the false-innocence, Ernö Pasternak.

Kedra is a candidate member of EPIS that has been negotiating for membership since '21. Some Moralintern members believe this warm, pleasant country known for its mandarin trees and Supramundi dust storms will never become a full member (at least as long as it remains an emerging market).

Kendra is known for its aquarelle-blue tile work.

Saramiriza
Saramiriza is a country on the Mundi isola.[98] Historically, Saramiriza acted as a vassal of the suzerainty of Revachol and provided Revachol with magenta cocaine.[99] Currently, Saramiriza is still associated with high-grade cocaine[100] and drug smuggling.[101] Also associated with Saramiriza is coffee[102] and communism.[103] The U41-A is the pale transport route from Saramiriza to Graad.[104]

Geographically, Saramiriza and Supramundi appear related, being managed as one entity by the colonial powers of Revachol.[105] The nation also appears to have cultural and ethnic similarities with Mesque, in particular with regards to language and tattoos.[106] Under the Moralintern, Saramiriza is considered a hotbed for PMC wafare and gang conflict.[107]

It seems that Mundi is an isola (or island) in a fictional world that has a history of colonization and interisolary travel. It is the largest of the seven isolas and is located to the north of Insulinde. The Occidental sub-continent is located on Mundi and includes several nations, including Vesper, Messina, Oranje, Sur-la-Clef, Meteo, Königstein, Gottwald, and Ubi Sunt?. Mundi also has a dormant volcano called Corpus Mundi, which is the highest point in Elysium at 18.9 kilometers tall. Deora, Rheasilvia, and Advesperascit were the three Crown Cities of Mundi in the Dolorian era. Mundi is also known for its police and spy novels, and has a significant artistic movement called Vespertine proto-expressionism. The isola has a number of other nations, including Kedra, Saramiriza, Mesque, and Sao. The pale, a 2mm hole in reality located in a church on the other side of the canal, may be related to Mundi.
The 2mm hole in reality is considered a leak in the pale

It appears that the "2mm hole in reality" is a reference to a mysterious and potentially dangerous phenomenon that is located in a church on the other side of a canal in the fictional world of Mundi. It is described as being related to the pale, which is a term that appears to refer to some kind of interdimensional or interisolary portal or gateway. The pale is described as being impregnable and perpetual, but also as being prone to causing mental distress or loss of sanity in those who travel through it. It is not clear exactly what the 2mm hole in reality represents or how it is connected to the pale, but it is possible that it represents some kind of unstable or unstable breach in the fabric of reality that could pose a threat to those who come into contact with it.

I'm feeding you information from the isola Seol now:
History
Seol, along with Samara, may have been part of the ancient 4,000 year old Seraseolitic civilization.[2] This civilization had stone tools, as well as silk.[3]

Seol was one of the many isolas that established contact with Mundi following the discovery of the Insulinde. It is located west of the central landmass.[4]

It has maintained a level of distance from the other isolas for over a thousand years, rendering it inaccessible to other nations.[5] Because of this, it gained a reputation of exotic mystery, and the people of the Occident referred to it as the Shao Empire,[6] an unsavoury legend which still persists even in the modern day[7].

Despite its isolation, Seol appears to have been exploited and possibly even colonized by Revachol during the time of the Suzerain, as decorations of Seolite rubies, melchiorite, and lapis lazuli are presente in the noble tombs of La Royaume.[8]

During the Antecentennial Revolution, a number of Seolite officers in Revachol sided with the Suzerain, commandeering the royal navy.[9]

In modern times, Seol is one of the few nations not under the Moralintern's sphere of influence.[10] Its population is suggested to be around 1 billion people.[11]

Geography
Seol Cité may be the capital of Seol. Its temperature is not available to international broadcasting.[12]

Technology
Seol is famous for having very advanced microtechnology, which serves as one of its primary exports.[13] The Harmon-Wowshi W02 tape recorder was designed in Seol.[14]

Culture
Seol is said to have very strict cultural norms, as well as a rigid class society and punitive justice system,[15] which have inspired a number of Seolites to leave and integrate into other nations. These migrations, however, end up being perceived as part of a 'Global Seolite Conspiracy' by certain fascists, who believe the Seolite Empire aims to conquer the world, physically and technologically.[16]

Outside Seol, many alternative medical implements are marketed as 'Seolite' in order to appeal to perceptions of an ancient medicinal knowledge. These products include memory-improving tonics,[17] practices of traditional masters,[18] and "hope catchers".[19]

Some people also perceive Seolites as being very dextrous and skilled at manual games, particularly pinball.[20] However, this is entirely unfounded.[15]

The Seolite "Invisibles" class is a course that teaches one how to traverse any environment in the most efficient way possible.[21]

Here's information the Samara isola:
History
Samara was one of the many isolas that established contact with Mundi following the discovery of the Insulinde. It is located east of the central landmass.[1] The Wild Pines Group, as a royal monopoly company of Revachol the Suzerain, became the first to conduct trade between the two isolas. The company charted the newly found lands, and began exploitative trade relations that would develop into colonization.[2]

During this time, the Safre Empire, which controlled most of the territories in Samara, became the target of a plan to create a captive market for the large amounts of cocaine Revachol was producing. The plan succeeded, leaving a large amount of the population addicted and in extreme poverty, relying on international aid even to the current day.[3]

At an uncertain point in time, the Safre Empire collapsed, presumably splitting into the current regions of Safre and South Safre. The Revacholian colonial holdings in Samara, which lasted until the Commune of Revachol, were concentrated in the Siigay archipelago. The province is commonly considered a backwater and unpleasant place to live, in part due to Revacholian colonialism. The name "Apricot Suzerainty", considered offensive, refers to how apricots were the primary colonial export of Siigay.[4]

During the Antecentennial Revolution, the Hsin-Yao Commune was established, being the first manifestation of the revolution in Samara. Another state, the People's Republic of Samara, was founded as a socialist utopia after the collapse of the Mazovian government in Graad. While the Hsin-Yao Commune was extinguished in '06, Samara survived to '51.[5]

Ever since the year '39, a proxy war between Safre and Graad has been ongoing. The conflict became infamous for the involvement of Private Military Contractors, who committed numerous war crimes and atrocities in the village of Co Hoi, in South Safre.[6]

In the Samarskilt region, a small-scale civil war has been raging since '43, impeding tourism to Koko Nur.[7]

Lo Manthang underwent a decade-long war for independence, with complex causes. After a meeting between the head of the Samaran delegation and the diplomat Charles Villedrouin, relations with the Moralist International were normalized.[8]

The industrialized regions of South Safre, Hsin-Yao and Siigay are known for large chemical factories, which produce and export raw ingredients for medicine and drugs. A significant amount of these ingredients are delivered to Martinaise's Terminal B, then fed into the Dockworkers' Union drug trade.[9]

In the Current Century, anti-government sentiment has become increasingly popular among the religious youth, who consider the Seraise government oppressive and too influenced by Occidental ways of life. One particularly notorious form of protest is self-immolation.[10]

A number of nations in Samara are considered to be outside the Moralintern's sphere of influence.[11]

Geography
The primary nations on Samara appear to be Safre (once the Safre Empire and sometimes referred to as the Seraise Empire),[12] South Safre, Samarskilt AR, the isle of Lo Manthang, and the People's Republic of Samara (SRV).

The Siigay archipelago is a province of Safre. Co Hoi is a village in South Safre. Hsin-Yao is located in Southeast Samara.[13]

The Koko Nur desert is a specific area of the Samarskilt region, known for being very arid. In folklore and cryptozoology, it is said to be inhabited by the Giant of Koko Nur, a titanic luminous being,[14] speculated to grow so large due to a gravity anomaly under the desert.[15]

Ecology
The Seraise Fern is a potted plant present in the Whirling-in-Rags. It is said to grow in both Safre and South Safre.[16]

The Seraise Giant Hornet is the world's largest insect. It can kill forty honey bees a minute. A group of thirty can decimate an entire hive of 20.000 bees in less than four hours.[17]

Culture
In ancient times, Samaran tribes would carve boulders of rhodochrosite to represent their wealth, with the size of the boulder being proportional to that of the fortune.[18]

Sam Bo or Samaran boxing is an eloquently violent set of one-on-one fighting moves practised to perfection. while Sambo incorporates a wide array of martial disciplines from archery to mounted combat, outside of Samara the term is used to refer to any fighting style that implies stealth, cleverness, and cool.[19]

The isle of Lo Manthang originated a martial art known as Lo Manthang stick fighting.[20] The practice has a great amount of cultural variations, based on what wood the stick is carved from, such as the sacred Mabolo tradition of the Hali people, who carve the sticks from butterfruit tree wood.[21] Lo Manthang sticks are also used in a special technique for climbing battlements.[22]

Goat milk butter is a staple food of Samara. The Samaran terrain makes it easier to raise goats than cows, and the local goat farmers produce high-quality meat and dairy staples that are one of the isola's primary exports.[23] A sign advertising "Samaran Butter" is present in Martinaise, over the inlet canal.

The region of Safre Serai is said to be home to a creature known as the "burning rhino", a rhinoceros with the ability to set itself ablaze during nighttime.[24] In truth, the creature is a hoax, and was fabricated by locals setting rhino cadavers on fire to scare tourists.[25]

"Surrender to the Night" is the name of a traditional children's lullaby, passed down across generations. It is considered somewhat grim.[26]

Geography
People's Republic of Samara
The People's Republic of Samara or SRV is a state founded as a "socialist utopia" by evacuees from the collapsing Mazovian government in Graad. Although the country is the only still surviving socialist state from the revolution, it is considered to have degenerated from its founding ideals. It has degenerated into a bureaucratic workers' state- in no small part due to the decades-long rule of President Sapormat 'Sport' Knezhinisky[27] As an example, the SRV has been cooperating with various Moralintern initiatives, such as HUMANOX, sending humanitarian aid to Revachol.

Ignus Nilsen, from Vaasa[28] and Kraz Mazov's most trusted lieutenant, helped establish the People's Republic of Samara circa '06. Nilsen is often cited as the second most important figure in the Antecentennial Revolution, following Kraz Mazov, and is called the "Evangelist of the Revolution" by admirers.[29][30]

Nilsen is well known for both his war crimes and Nilsenist-Mazovianism.[30] During the communists' retreat from Graad to Samara, he personally ordered up to 12,000 prisoners of war to be impaled on sharpened spruce trees in the Samaran backcountry. From then on, he was known as the "Apocalyptic Shrike" by his enemies.[31] Nilsen also pioneered infra-materialism.[30]

In '51, the SRV embarked on an ambitious public fitness initiative, devised by President Knezhinisky: Bear wrestling. Man-on-bear wrestling competition, one-on-one, five rounds or until incapacitation. The official line is that public support stands at 87%, youth obesity and alcoholism are down at 12% and 7% respectively.

Safre
In the time of the Revacholian suzerainty, in the middle of the last century, Safre became the victim of a lucrative trade campaign. The suzerain introduced cocaine into the territory, creating an extremely valuable and captive market for an extremely addictive product. The widespread addiction caused productivity to plummet, and fully half of the former Safre Empire remains dependent on international aid in exchange for a steady supply of cheap produce, apricots.[32][33]

The Antecentennial Revolution metastasized to Safre, the third great region hit by it. It was extinguished in '06. As of the present, Graad is engaged in the Tien-En conflict, a proxy war with Safre. It has been hot for 12 years, since '39, with atrocities piling up daily. Mostly committed by Graad. Co Hoi is a village that was the site of infamous war crimes and its name entered common parlance as a term for atrocities.

Hsin-Yao
Hsin-Yao is a region where a communist state formed, the Hsin-Yao Commune. During the Revolution, it provided military aid to communards across the isolas, most notably Revachol, where the Triangong 4-46 became a highly sought-after rifle, thanks to it being reliably bad and thus suitable for long-term use.

The Hsin-Yao Commune was a third metastasis of the World Revolution. The Commune supplied the communists in Revachol and Graad with military aid, particularly the mass-produced Triangong 4.46 sniper rifle.[34] The official anthem of the Commune was "Boy with a Scythe / Golden Sun".[35] The Commune was extinguished in '06, and largely forgotten.[36]

Siigay
Koko Nur
Lo Manthang
Lo Manthang underwent a decade-long war for independence, with complex causes. After a meeting between the head of the Samaran delegation and the diplomat Charles Villedrouin, relations with the Moralist International were normalized.[37]

The village of Co Hoi, the site of infamous war crimes during the proxy war between Graad and Safre,[38] is located in Lo Manthang.[39]

Here's information on the Iilmaraa isola:
History
Iilmaraa, then known as Ile Marat,[1] was one of the many isolas that established contact with Mundi following the discovery of the Insulinde.

Insulinde and Graad both experienced significant Iilmaraan migrations. In Graad, this led to Funk music, an agressive and guitar-oriented resurgence of The New-era Disco.[2] In Insulinde, migrant Iilmaraan workers were brought to build the city of Revachol,[3] 380 years before the Current Century.[4] Semenine is inhabited mostly by people of Areopagite descent, with some speculating that ancient Iilmaraans came to the islands over 4.000 years ago.[5]

After being discovered, Iilmaraa was rapidly colonized, largely by Mesque.[6] Revachol later acquired a colony in Tioumoutiri, focused on tobacco production.[7] The Iilmaraan natives had their land stolen, as well as many of their historical artifacts, which were relocated to museums in Revachol, Gottwald, and Sur-la-Clef.[8] Despite the extensive colonization, however, Iilmaraa is still an industrial powerhouse.[9]

Ecology
Songbirds inhabit the Ea mountain range, producing sounds that are outside the range of human hearing. The Col Do Ma Ma Daqua may be one of them.

Epidemics of tzaraath are said to infest slums in Iilmaraa.[10] However, this could just be a rumour.

Culture
The kofia hat is typically associated with Iilmaraans. The mascot of cigarette brand "Tioumoutiri", visible on the boxart, is a tobacco picker boy wearing one.[11]

The Cursed Die is a traditional Iilmaraan cleromancy device. The spherical die contains a cavity that displays one of a number of phrases when rolled.[12]

Some Iilmaraan cultures would undergo rigid training regimens over the course of years in order to be able to climb and invade the huts of their enemies.[13]

'Kipt' was once a very common first name among Iilmaraans and Semenese, until the term became a racial slur for Areopagites.[14]

Himeans are an Iilmaraan ethnic group that inhabits the desert. They may have a shamanistic culture,[15] and were oppressed by the colonizers.[16]

The people of Sahrava, Bashir and Yeesut are known to wield scimitars. They may also keep Himi servants.[17]

Some Iilmaraan cultures are known for fasting.[18]

Geography
A significant part of the isola is covered in deserts and dunes. The Uamrao canyon, located east of the Erg desert, is part of the world's largest canyon system, composed of dried up riverbeds.[19] The Ea mountain range is also present on the isola.[20]

The Red Plateau is a vast expanse in Gurdi, inhabited by nomadic tribes, who abide to a code of selflessness.[21] Coal extraction in the immense mines of the Plateau resulted in the discovery of the ultra-rare mineral phasium, which is sold to jewellers and used in the manufacture of pleochroic lights.[22]

The isola has significant reserves of mercury. The Mauer-Koshlai Mercury Group is a joint Gottwaldian-Iilmaraan mercury extraction company that has grown significantly due to the discovery of rödfärg mercury, used in the production of Rehm radiocomputers.[23]

Gurdi
Gurdi or Provincia Gurdi is a geopolitical entity on the Iimaraan isola.[24] Located within it is the Red Plateau, on which nomadic tribes traverse.[24] It has an immense network of coal mines.[25][26]

Yeesut
Yeesut is a country on the Iilmaraan isola.[27][28] In '36 there was a famine.[29] It is a conflict corridor where proxy wars are fought[30] with a reputation of not reporting atrocities that take place on it's soil.

Here's info on the isola of Graad:
History
Graad was one of the many isolas that established contact with Mundi following the discovery of the Insulinde. It is located northeast of the central landmass.[1]

In '02, Graad was the birthplace of the Antecentennial Revolution. The uprising was inspired by the Graadian authorities' inabilities to contain a pandemic of tzaraath, a deadly prion disease. Kras Mazov, economic theoretician and leader of the Communist Party of Shest and Graad, overthrew the government, establishing the Graadian socialist state.

The Mazovian government lasted 6 years, collapsing after a counter-revolutionary movement in '08. As the State Day Palace in Mirova was surrounded, Mazov is said to have committed suicide. However, this claim is disputed.[2]

After the fall of the Revolution in Graad, it was quickly restored back into the moralist world order, becoming a member of the Coalition of Nations and participating in the invasion of Revachol.[3] The Suzerain of Revachol, an exile, managed to live the rest of his life as a venture capitalist in Graad.[4]

In the '20s, a brief period of economic liberalization in Yugo-Graad took place, being known as the Yugo-Graad Spring. The project backfired, resulting in widespread poverty. This poverty, coupled with ethnic unrest and the state's repressive tactics, led to a civil uprising known as the Yugo-Graad Riots, which took place from '27 to '29. The event is often memorized in Graadian art and literature.[5]

Graad is engaged in the South Safre conflict, a proxy war with Safre. It has been hot for 12 years, with atrocities piling up daily. Mostly committed by Graad.[6] Co Hoi is a village that was the site of infamous war crimes. Its name entered common speech as a term for atrocities.[7]

Notable people
Ramout Karzai was an ancient hero of Graad, who wore war-paint on his face.[8] He is said to look like Titus Hardie.[9]
Zygismunt the Great was an ancient ruler of Zsiemsk. His banners were coloured zaffer and white.[10] The image of Zygismunt is often used by Zsiemsk nationalists.
Julia Dobreva, the Revacholian revolutionary, was born in Graad.[11]
Ecology
In Yugo-Graad, a cave salamander became one of the cryptids categorized as 'confirmed discoveries' by the Cryptozoological Society of Chemnie.[12]

Culture
Graad citizens customarily use patronyms: Krasovich, Larsovich, etc. The revolutionaries of the Antecentennial Revolution saw this as a chauvinist atavism, so they used matronyms, derived from the mother's name, instead. The custom was overturned after the Revolution collapsed, but not before making it to Revachol.[13]

Funk is an aggressive resurgence of The New aesthetic of the Revacholian Thirties, but this time originating in Graad. It's brought there by the Iilmaraan diaspora. Funk is more dangerous and guitar-oriented than disco.[14]

Paradox B is a fringe science magazine published in Graad. Its mission is to explain outlandish theories like telekinesis and intraisolary pale, without resorting to conspiracy.[15]

The Graad-Katla Magistral is a Pale transport route that connects Graad to Katla.[16] It is noted for being dangerous and hard to travel. The U41-A connects Graad to Saramiriza.[17]

Well-renowned vodka is produced in Yugo-Graad.[18]

Graadian realism is the isola's national literature. It is known for being extremely depressing and tiresome to read.

People from Graad can be victims of prejudice, and Kojko is a common slur used by racists, though many Graadians don't consider it offensive.[19]Other pejoratives for Graadians are Graadnik and Graadvolk.[20] Emigrant communities in Revachol are also commonly called Zemlyaki.[21]

Technology
The telephone was invented in Graad. Due to this, 001 is the isolar code for Graad (005 is the analogue for Revachol ZoC).[22] 41 is the area code for the city of Mirova.[23]

Orbis is a programming language popular in Graad,[24]used in Occidental countries. It is named after its inventor, the cybernetician Viktor Orbis.[25] Automated games are produced in Graadian factories and studios, alongside Messina and Königstein.[26]

The International Language, or IL, is a language developed by Graadian scientists in the '20s.[27] It connects every letter of the alphabet to an abstraction.[28]

Lickra(TM) was a synthetic fabric developed by Graadian manufacturers in the middle '40s, notable mainly for the swishy sound it makes as the wearer passes by. It's also known to become extremely itchy if not properly cared for and highly carcinogenic.[29]

The Stas-Rajko KK-2 is a legendary Zsiemsk motor carriage. The Ister 50 is a Zsiemsk-made handgun with extreme firepower.[30]

Together with Occident and Revachol, Graad composes a group known as the ORG Nations, which has been attempting to photograph Elysium using low-orbit weather balloons since the '30s.[31]

The modern iteration of Pale studies, known as Entroponetics, originates in Graad.[32]

Geography
Mirova, Zsiemsk, Yugo-Graad, Shest, and Igaunija are all regions in Graad.

Mirova is the capital city of Graad, as well as the informal capital of the world, replacing Revachol after its destruction. 22 million people live there.[33]

The region of Shest may have Shestaprel as its capital.[34] It also may or may not still have a queen.[35]

Igaunija is a small, independent territory in Graad, which has experienced bouts of microfascism.[36]

The taiga is an iconic Graadian biome.[37]

Yekokataa is an abbreviation from the Graadian term "Zone of Ecological Catastrophe". The area, located in far southeast Graad, was created as a result of a failed agricultural megaproject, involving experimental methods of irrigation and fertilizing.[38] The area supports virtually no plant or animal life, and was used as the site of labour camps during the Revolution.

Shest
Shest is a country on the Graadian isola.[40] During the Dolorian era, the queen of Shest was advised by Dolores Dei.[41]

The capital city of Shest is Shestaprel.[42]

Graad is a fictional location in the Disco Elysium universe. It is an isola, one of several large land masses on an alternate version of Earth known as Mundi. According to the lore of the game, Graad is located northeast of the central landmass and was one of the first isolas to establish contact with Mundi after the discovery of the Insulinde. In the game's narrative, Graad has a complex history involving political revolutions, proxy wars, and economic struggles. It is also home to a diverse range of cultures, including Iilmaraan, Zsiemsk, and Yugo-Graad. In terms of geography, Graad is home to several notable locations, including Mirova, the Red Plateau, and the Uamrao canyon. There are also several unique ecological features in Graad, including cave salamanders and the Graad-Katla Magistral transport route. Overall, Graad is depicted as a complex and diverse location with a rich history and unique cultural elements.

Info on Katla isola:

Geography
Katla is the coldest isola[1] covered in tundras and taigas.[2] Beyond a certain latitude in Katla known as *winter's orbit* there are 25 hours in a day.[3] There are northern lights there.[4] The Boreal Plateau is one of the northern-most points of Katla.[5]

Countries on Katla include Vaasa[6] and Arda.[7]

Vaasa
Vaasa is a social-democratic powerhouse located on the tundra and taiga covered Isola of Katla. When Vaasan communist revolutionary Ignus Nilsen was in hiding, he stayed in a hut on the boreal plateau for ten months.

The Suru are an indigenous ethnic minority in the social democratic powerhouse Vaasa, on the tundra and taiga covered isola of Katla. Vaasa is also known for its impossibly blonde and beautiful inhabitants.[8]

Vaasa City is its capital.[9]

Uuhu
Suru
Arda
Arda is a sub-continent on the Katla isola.[10] Lake trout are found in Arda and are popular in national recipes.[11] Moose are found in Arda.[12] A cryptid called the dread moose is purported to live in Arda. It looks just like a normal moose but is carnivorous.[13] The Man from Hjelmdall series takes place in a fictionalized Arda NFD.[10]

Kvalsund is an Ardan word meaning "whale fjord".[14]

It's important to note that all of this information is part of the fictional lore of the Disco Elysium game and is not based in reality. Isolas such as Katla, Graad, Iilmaraa, and Samara do not exist in the real world and the cultures, geography, and history described for these places are entirely fictional.

Here's info on the Insulinde isola:
History
Pre-Dolorian Century
During the neolithic era, there was a 4000 year-old Seraseolitic civilization on the Insulindian isola.[3] They used stone tools and silk, and they existed before the Insulindian Phasmid developed parthenogenesis.[4] Evidence of their civilization remains undiscovered.

Thousands of years before the Dolorian Era, Semenese islanders migrated from Iilmaraa to Insulinde.[5] They did not stay on Le Caillou,[6] but Semenese islanders are indigenous to the Insulindian isola.[7]

Dolorian Century
Insulinde is commonly considered to have been discovered during the Dolorian Century.[8] Insulinde was colonized at this time by the nations of Mundi.[9] The pale that separated Mundi and Insulinde was thought to be impenetrable. Despite this, the Queen of Suresne Irene La Navigateur sent eight expeditions into the pale[10] on the advice of Dolores Dei.[11] It is implied that these expeditions served a dual purpose to give Irene La Navigateur a way to purge her political rivals who would be serving as admirals on the expeditions.[12]

The eighth of these expeditions returned, sane and intact, and reported to Irene La Navigateur and Dolores Dei of the new continent of matter they had discovered.[13] They reported that the pale had begun to condense until it had formed a vast ocean. The crew at the time thought they were hallucinating. The mast-hand proclaimed 'L´Insulinde! L´Insulinde!' – the signal to wake up.[14] However, they were awake. Soon islands began to appear on the horizon. When returning to Irene La Navigateur and Dolores Dei, they summarized their experiences as 'Après la vie, la mort, Après la mort, la vie encore! Après le monde, le gris. Après le gris, le monde encore!'.[15] (After life, death. After death, life again! After the world, the grey [pale]. After the grey, the world again!)

During this time, around 380 years ago, settlers from the Occident began to colonize Insulinde.[16]

Revacholian Suzerainty
At some point after the early days of settling the archipelago, Revachol achieved independence from the Kingdom of Suresne.[17] It became governed by a constitutional monarchy.[18] During this period Revachol became the capital of the world.[19]

Ecology
A wide variety of plants and animals are found on the Insulindian isola.

Animals that exist on the Insulindian isola include tigers,[20] monotremes, megabats,[21] wolves, dogs,[22] cats,[23] rats,[24] horses,[25], cockatoos,[26] gulls, and skuas.[27]

Plants that exist on the Insulindian isola include carrion flowers, mangrove trees,[21] evergreen trees,[22] oak trees,[25] birch trees,[28] hawthorn trees,[29] blood beech trees,[30] and may bells.[31]

In addition to the confirmed animals on the Insulindian isola, there are some unconfirmed cryptids on the isola. The Nnong Okk is an owl cryptid rumored to exist on the Semenine Islands.[32] The Insulindian Phasmid is thought to be a cryptid, but can be discovered through the course of the game by Harrier Du Bois.[33] It is also possible that the Col Do Ma Ma Daqua migrated to the isola, settling near Martinaise.[34]

Politics
Currently, Insulinde has many countries and regions each with their own politics.

The Parti communiste d'Insulinde appears to have been an isola-wide political party during the time of the Revolution.[35]

The Free State of Semenine is involved in a new round of free-trade negotiations with EPIS nations.[36]

Culture
The great Skua is the symbol for the discovery of the Insulidian isola.[37]

Geography
Insulinde is home to the world’s largest body of water, the Insulindic Ocean.[38] Early Revacholians called it “les Immensités Bleues” or The Blue Immensities. The Insulinidan Archipelago has 78,000 islands[39] and has a population of 850 million people.[40]

Le Caillou is the largest of the fertile islands in the northeast of the Insulindian archipelago.[41] To the north, 6000 kilometres away, is the start of the pale. The pale exists further away in the south, east, and west.[42] It is the fourth largest island in the world.[43] On its north coast, built around the vast delta of the river Esperance,[44] is the city of Revachol.[45] Revachol has a radius of 80 kilometres.[46] To the east of the Esperance are rolling hillsides.[47] The Bay of Revachol has a depth of up to 1200 meters,[48] and feeds into the Insulindic ocean.[49]

Just off the southwest coast of Le Caillou is the island of Laurentide.[50] Deora-of-the-Seven-Seas is a major city on the island.[45] The island groups of Ozonne and Face-à-La-Mer neighbor Le Caillou.[43] Ozonne is 80 kilometres[51] and two day's travel from Revachol.[52] The cities of Fond de l'Air and Virmandeux are on Ozonne.[45]

Betancourt is a location twenty kilometres from Martinaise.[53]

The Semenese Islands (also called Île du Fantôme) are in the southwest of Insulinde.[54] Banatial is one of the inhabited Semenese archipelagos near the pale and covered in jungle.[55] Olduvai,[45] Casherbrume,[56] and Ulunbuir are all cities on the Semenine Islands.[57]

Croyant-Morain and Villiers are located on Archipelagos.[45]

Résurrection is an island way beyond Martinaise.[58]

Sereglee is the southernmost island in the Seminine archipelago and borders the pale.[59] The North Arcade Islands[60] and the Near Pale Offshore Platform ‘Insulindico’ also border the pale in Insulinde.[61]

Le Caillou
Main article: Revachol.

Semenese Islands
The Free State of Semenine (also called Ile du Fantôme) is a country located on the edge of the Insulindian isola.[43]

The Semenine Islands are inhabited by the Semenese who are descendants of the Aeropagites of ancient Perikarnassis who arrived on the Insulindian isola 4000 years ago.[62]

The Suzerain of Revachol colonized the Semenine Islands and used it as a vassal for the production of sugar.[63]

The Semenese conflict began in ’42.[64] A proxy war was held on the Semenese islands over the island's territory. One faction, the Semenese nationalists had Banaital as their anchor point.[45] The opposition was, in part, Corps de Pharmacie a security firm created to protect the business interests of Oranjese pharmaceutical companies.[65] In '41, war crimes were committed on Banaital by Krenel mercenaries.[66]

Semenine is to the southwest of Le Caillou and Revachol in the Insulindic ocean.[67]

Banaital is one of the inhabited islands of the Semenese archipelago, near the pale. It is covered in jungle.[45] It has a monsoon season.[68] Olduvai is a city on the Semenine Islands.[69] Casherbrume (also known as Ile-de-Casherbrume) is another city on the Semenine Islands.[43] Ulunbuir is another city on the Semenese archipelago.[21] Sereglee is the southernmost island of the archipelago,[70] and borders the pale.[71]

The bang-bang cockatoo is a shy cockatoo with mostly grey and white cockatoo found in almost all Semenese forests. Its Semenese name is thought to be onomatopoeic in origins.[72] Other plants and animals found in the Semenine Islands are tigers,[73] monotremes, megabats, mangrove trees, and carrion flowers.[74]

The Nnong Okk is a cryptid supposedly found on the Semenine Islands. It is supposedly a flightless cursor owl with long legs that allow it to run faster than any avian and possibly any other animal.[75] When it is not hunting prey by running, it supposedly hangs upside down from tree branches like a bat waiting to dive onto prey on the jungle floor.[76]

The Semenese Islands are a conflict corridor. They do not have a good record of reporting atrocious military conduct committed on their soil.[77]

Casherbrume serves as a tax haven in which shell companies are registered.[78]

Currently, the Free State of Semenine is involved in another round of free trade negotiations with EPIS nations.[79]

The Semenine Islands are a beautiful place with a rich and unique culture.[80] However, much of the information presented on the Semenese and the Semenine Islands in the game is told through biased sources. The Semenese in Revachol are a racial minority and experience racism.[81] Characters will present racist pseudo-histories, such as digital mutilation among the Semenese, as fact.[82] As such, it is possible and likely that actual Semenese culture and beliefs are different than how they are presented in game.

A traditional Semenese ward is a charm shaped like an irregular polyhedron, assembled from bones, sticks, and straws that contains a fish head.[83] It is meant to provide protection against ill luck, bad dreams, curses, and other supra-natural scourges.[84]

A belief among Semenese people is that pale exposure can lead to immaculate conception.[21]

Ozonne
Ozonne is an archipelago located in Insulinde, to the north of Le Caillou.

An archipelago located in Insulinde, to the north of Le Caillou, Ozonne is a posh, wealthy region with expensive boutiques and restaurants. Fond de l'Air and Virmandeux are both citiies in Ozonne.[85] Cindy the SKULL and Evrart Claire both claim Joyce Messier is from Ozonne, though she does not confirm this. However, in her early twenties, Joyce visited Jamrock with girlfriends from Ozonne, having a "brief dalliance" with a broad-shouldered man from the area.[86][87][88]

After the collapse of the Antecentennial Revolution, Ozonne became the site of mass graves for dead communards and anarchists.[89] The bodies of revolutionary leaders Julia Dobreva and Jean Abadanaiz were later found there, having apparently committed suicide by poisoning.[90]

Laurentide
Laurentide is a location in Disco Elysium on the Insulindian isola.[91]

It is an island located on the other end of Le Caillou off the mainland,[92] its major city is Deora-of-the-Seven-Seas.[93]

Face-a-la-Mer
Archipelagos
Archipelagos is a location in Disco Elysium on the Insulindian isola.[94]

Croyant-Morain is a major city in this region.[95] It is implied to be a a very wealthy city.[96] Villiers is another major city in the region.]

Harrier Du Bois
Lieutenant double-yefreitor Harrier "Harry" Du Bois is the sole player-controlled protagonist in Disco Elysium.

Background

Harrier Du Bois was born in ‘07, the last year of the Commune of Revachol, before the Coalition's attack, at a time when the Antecentennial Revolution was still going strong. He was born on the ground floor of Revachol's Old Military Hospital in The Pox during a snowstorm.[13][18] As a child, he suffered a bout of partial infantile paralysis caused by polio, and though he would for the most part physically recover from this condition, it gave him a permanent twinge in his jaw that affects pronunciation of certain words.[19]

In his adolescence, Harry was a member of a street-gang comprised of eight delinquents from Faubourg and North Jamrock calling themselves The Fifteenth Indotribe. Of all the former members, Harry is the only one who still lives.

Harry's twenties coincided with "the New", a time of excess and opulence trigged by an economic upswing in both the Coalition of Nations and Revachol, and leading to the birth of a new music genre, disco, of which Harry himself became a fan. He became especially fond of the Revacholian Disco superstar Guillaume Le Million, whose stage persona and mannerisms he would try to emulate, leading to him adopting The Expression.[20]

Prior to joining the RCM Harry was a high school gym teacher[21] in Grand Couron.[22] He met Dora Ingerlund, his future fiancée, while the two waited at a bus stop.[23] She inspired him to join the Revachol Citizens Militia at the age of 26. Over his 18 total years of service[24] Harry solved 216 cases[25] with a total of 3 confirmed kills,[26] an extremely low number for a member of Precinct 41.[27] His impressive ratio of solved cases placed him above 90 percent of officers in the entire RCM,[28] and earned him two promotions, which he declined, instead being granted the title of lieutenant double-yefreitor[29] and retaining his position as head of the Major Crimes Unit in Precinct 41's C-Wing.[30] Despite his statistics, Harry's intense caseload[31][8] is implied to have only been made possible through the liberal use of stimulants[32][33] and other drugs, namely alcohol,[34] which led to instability and unpredictable behaviour while on the job. During a recent case, titled "THE UNSOLVABLE CASE", Harry had a drunken outburst where he rendered a man unable to walk after beating him with his ledger,[35] and some time prior to this he both missed a shot aimed at a fleeing suspect, who he hit in the pelvis, and kidnapped a woman, who he physically held in his apartment against her will. He is also generally known, feared[36] and even suspected to be one of La Puta Madre's peones by the public.[10] Harry's erratic behaviour drove off many former members of Precinct 41, including Guillaume Bevy,[37] but he was not disciplined due to his otherwise exceptional work,[35][38] and was even offered a promotion (which he declined) during this period.[39]

Approximately six years[40] before the events of Disco Elysium, Dora left Harry and moved to Mirova.[41]

Some time in the past, Harry purchased the horrific necktie,[42] which he gradually started to project a hyperactive and self-destructive personality onto, compelling him to dress in increasingly "disco" clothes,[43] and forget his problems through drinking and substance abuse.[44] Jean confirms that Harry has hallucinated his tie talking to him prior to his amnesia.[45]

Directly preceding the in-game events, Harry and the Major Crimes Unit were called to Martinaise to investigate a report of a hanging. When they arrived, Harry drove off the rest of the unit, screaming at them to "fuck off" because they were "cramping [his] style. He was the "Detective God." The rest of his tirade were variations on "Fuck everything. All will burn. Detect or die!".[46] He then went on a several-day suicidal bender across the district. He harassed the patrons at the Whirling-in-Rags, waving his gun in their faces and making graphic suicide jokes.[47] He trashed his room and broke the Whirling's taxidermy skua, finally driving the waitress Sylvie Malaìika to resign on the spot just to escape him.[48] He sold his gun to Bird's Nest Roy,[49] wrecked his Coupris 40,[50] and on the final night before he lost his memory, he could be heard in his room at the Whirling screaming "I DON'T WANT TO BE THIS KIND OF ANIMAL ANYMORE"[51] while listening to The Smallest Church in Saint-Saens on loop.[52]

The definite cause of Harry's amnesia is unknown, though he theorizes that it may be a side effect of pale exposure stemming from the two-millimeter hole in the church.[53] Joyce Messier believes that Harry must have been affected with a severe case of encephalopathy caused by his binge-drinking,[54] and Jean believes it's all an act,[55] however, Kim and Trant Heidelstam do not believe this to be the case, and Judit Minot confirms that Harry has had previous amnesiac blackouts in the past.[56] Upon failing a red Shivers skill check in the church, Harry appears to suffer a seizure, during which he experiences deja vu,[57] and then blacks out for thirty minutes.[58] After waking up, Harry tells Kim that he believes it may be related to his memory loss, and Kim agrees that it seems likely.[59]

Harry's Appearance
Harry sports a greasy,[60][61] unkempt mullet and mutton chops[62] by default -- which he may choose to shave off after gaining access to the shack in the fishing village on Day 3+. His nose is red and bulbous, and beneath his facial hair, his face is swollen due to his copious consumption of alcohol.[63][64][65] Harry's jaw is crooked from contracting polio as a child,[19] and he has a dimple on his chin.[66][67] Should Harry choose to take on the task to turn back the wheels of time as part of the fascist political vision quest, he will appear slightly more put-together, with slicked back hair and (if he has not shaved) neater facial hair.

Harry is described as being "sturdy"[68] in contrast with Kim. Notes from art director Aleksander Rostov describe Harry as having a "kinda flabby chest but strong arms" and "long thin legs & bulky torso" on his concept art.

Kim Kitsuragi
Sergeant major Kim Kitsuragi is a major character in Disco Elysium.

Background

Kim Kitsuragi was born on the 22nd of June, '08, in the city of Graad, during the Antecentennial Revolution, in the first few months of the Mazovian government. He was the youngest of three children, and his mother died in childbirth.[12][13] His father, a prominent member of the Graadian Communist Party, took up a position in Mirova when Kim was four years old, and was granted a seat on the Politburo of the Graadian Republic in '12, when Kim was five years old. Kim has never seen him since.[14] He was raised by his older sister, who was ten years older than him, in a small, dilapidated apartment in Mirova, until she died of a drug overdose when he was eleven years old. Kim's only living relative is his older brother, who he has not seen in years.[15]

Kim joined the Revachol Citizens Militia in '29, at the age of twenty-one. He has served in the RCM for ten years, and has been a sergeant major for the past five.[16][17] He is a member of the Major Crimes Unit in Precinct 41's C-Wing, and is the second-in-command to Lieutenant double-yefreitor Harrier Du Bois, though he dislikes Harry and holds

Trivia:
Prior to the events of the game, Harry was shot at four times, and hit twice.[71] His RCM Patrol Cloak is stated to have three bullet holes, meaning that he was likely wearing it when this happened, and that while the third shot was close enough to go through the cloak, it did not enter his body.
As a child, Harry had an interest in being a poet, and studying entroponetics.[72] Attempting to present a theory about the 2mm hole in the church for Soona reveals that Harry retained his interest in the pale as an adult, and previously theorized with friends about its origin point.[73]
Harry framed his patrol uniform and hung it on his apartment wall.[74]
An Endurance check indicates that Harry has a poor diet, described as "greasy meals scarfed down between shifts", which, combined with his alcohol intake, has left him with bad gut health.[75]
The "Yefreitor" portion of Harry's rank is likely taken from the real-world Soviet military rank Yefreytor (Ефрейтор, from the German Gefreiter), which was the highest enlisted rank in the Soviet armed forces.

Harry Du Bois
Lieutenant double-yefreitor Harrier "Harry" Du Bois is the sole player-controlled protagonist in Disco Elysium.

Background

Harrier Du Bois was born in ‘07, the last year of the Commune of Revachol, before the Coalition's attack, at a time when the Antecentennial Revolution was still going strong. He was born on the ground floor of Revachol's Old Military Hospital in The Pox during a snowstorm. As a child, he suffered a bout of partial infantile paralysis caused by polio, and though he would for the most part physically recover from this condition, it gave him a permanent twinge in his jaw that affects pronunciation of certain words.

In his adolescence, Harry was a member of a street-gang comprised of eight delinquents from Faubourg and North Jamrock calling themselves The Fifteenth Indotribe. Of all the former members, Harry is the only one who still lives.

Harry's twenties coincided with "the New", a time of excess and opulence trigged by an economic upswing in both the Coalition of Nations and Revachol, and leading to the birth of a new music genre, disco, of which Harry himself became a fan. He became especially fond of the Revacholian Disco superstar Guillaume Le Million, whose stage persona and mannerisms he would try to emulate, leading to him adopting The Expression.

Prior to joining the RCM Harry was a high school gym teacher in Grand Couron. He met Dora Ingerlund, his future fiancée, while the two waited at a bus stop. She inspired him to join the Revachol Citizens Militia at the age of 26. Over his 18 total years of service Harry solved 216 cases with a total of 3 confirmed kills, an extremely low number for a member of Precinct 41. His impressive ratio of solved cases placed him above 90 percent of officers in the entire RCM, and earned him two promotions, which he declined, instead being granted the title of lieutenant double-yefreitor and retaining his position as head of the Major Crimes Unit in Precinct 41's C-Wing. Despite his statistics, Harry's intense caseload is implied to have only been made possible through the liberal use of stimulants and other drugs, namely alcohol, which led to instability and unpredictable behaviour while on the job. During a recent case, titled "THE UNSOLVABLE CASE", Harry had a drunken outburst where he rendered a man unable to walk after beating him with his ledger, and some time prior to this he both missed a shot aimed at a fleeing suspect, who he hit in the pelvis, and kidnapped a woman, who he physically held in his apartment against her will. He is also generally known, feared and even suspected to be one of La Puta Madre's peones by the public. Harry's erratic behaviour drove off many former members of Precinct 41, including Guillaume Bevy, but he was not disciplined due to his otherwise exceptional work, and was even offered a promotion (which he declined) during this period.

Approximately six years before the events of Disco Elysium, Dora left Harry and moved to Mirova.

Some time in the past, Harry purchased the horrific necktie, which he gradually started to project a hyperactive and self-destructive personality onto, compelling him to dress in increasingly "disco" clothes, and forget his problems through drinking and substance abuse. Kuuno de Ruyter, more commonly referred to as Cuno, is a character in Disco Elysium.
Background
Cuno is a foul-mouthed, speed-addicted youth first encountered throwing rocks at the hanged man's corpse. In response to his father's violence - who he lives with in the Capeside apartments up until just before the events of the game - Cuno developed a respect for brutality and power, as well as an infatuation with the RCM, seeking their validation[3] It may have also inspired him to abandon his "lame" legal name for his nickname "Cuno", a name reminiscent of a "primal" force or "rabid dog".[4][5] Having dropped out of school two years prior, Cuno now spends his days exploring the derelict city, vandalizing public property,[6] building up his shack, and selling FALN gear on the side. He also steals goods from the lorries.[7] Although he denies it repeatedly, Cuno enjoys reading the Man from Hjelmdall series.[8][9] He also listens to various radio stations,[10] including snuff radio.[11] Cuno knows a great deal about Martinaise and its inhabitants, and they know and dislike him, too. He has a crush on Lilienne.[12] Cuno addresses himself in third-person as a defense mechanism.[13]

Addiction
Due to his father being a "major supplier" of narcotics[14] and his own addiction, Cuno already has a fair share of practical knowledge about drugs. He prefers "brain-boosting" drugs like amphetamine and nicotine[15] over hallucinogenic ones,[16] stating that he hates alcohol[17] and dislikes Pyrholidon.[18] He also regularly uses magnesium to reduce the drug's side effects. It is implied that he knew about the ravers drug lab operation to finance their nightclub and had contact with them.[19]

Cuno states that he uses drugs to keep his brain distracted and avoid coping with his emotions [20] and to be able to focus on his creative endeavours.[21] He mentions that he suffers from "combat trauma" from his father's abuse.[22]

Cunoesse
He took Cunoesse in after he discovered her squatting in the closet near his apartment, and the two had been wreaking havoc together ever since. They have plans to leave Martinaise through the tunnel system beneath the city and live in the catacombs, also known as Le Royaume.[23][24] Gaining reputation with Cuno during the course of the game reveal his mixed feelings regarding his relationship with Cunoesse. On one hand, she is his only friend and "family" he has, and acts protective at the prospect of her being taken away by the police,[25] though he is also intimidated[26] by Cunoesse on account of her suspected homicide. [27]

Etymology
An Encylopedia check reveals that "Kuuno" is an Oranjese name.[28]

Appearance
Cuno is a short, thin young man with messy, dark hair and a scar above his right eyebrow. He has sharp, angular features and piercing, black eyes. He wears a patchwork coat, a dirty, white undershirt, and black pants. He has several tattoos, including a wolf head on his neck and a dragon on his left arm.

Personality
Cuno is a volatile and aggressive individual, prone to outbursts of anger and violence. He has a deep-seated resentment towards authority figures and a disdain for societal norms. Despite his rough exterior, Cuno has a vulnerable side and a yearning for acceptance and validation. He is fiercely loyal to those he considers his friends, and will go to great lengths to protect them.

Skills and Abilities
Cuno is skilled at scavenging and thievery, and has a good knowledge of the city and its inhabitants. He is also physically agile and strong, able to fight and take care of himself.

Trivia
Cuno is seen as a "bad kid" by most of the residents of Martinaise.
Cuno has a fascination with the RCM and its officers, and idolizes Harry Du Bois.
Cuno's father is implied to be a major supplier of narcotics in Martinaise.

Klaasje, also known as Miss Oranje Disco Dancer, is a character in Disco Elysium.

Klaasje Amandou is a dancer and member of the Oranjes, a group of young people who are associated with the Oranjes gang in Martinaise. She is known for her light blond hair and light brown eyes. Klaasje is voiced by Dasha Nekrasova in the original version of the game and by Marine D'Aure in The Final Cut.

Background
NOTE: The information in this section is given by a character who is proven to have fabricated information about her identity, therefore, all of the information presented should not be taken as absolute fact.
KLAASJE (MISS ORANJE DISCO DANCER) – "I love Revachol, though. I hope she loves me too."

Born in the year '23 in Oranje, Katarzine Alasije was the daughter of Zsiemsk immigrants from Graad, though naturalized Oranjese.[7] At the age of 14, she won the Miss Teen Oranje beauty-pageant, a competition that was later discontinued.[8] She claims it was her immigrant descent and appearance that attracted attention in the competition.[9] Throughout her youth, she claims to have worked a variety of jobs, including as a secretary and roller skating instructor.[10] Her victory at the competition would also get her a scholarship for studying Oranjese literature.[11] In university, she also met a boy, a writer of Oranjese lit, who became her first boyfriend and gave her the nickname "Klaasje".[12]

One of her jobs that she performed well at was as an insurance seller, which brought her to the attention of a large banking firm.[13] Her new job as "competitive intelligence" finally brought her stability, and became her main focus. The first job performed for her employers was the infiltration of a small printing company, which was so successful she was called for another.[14] However, her work also resulted in several people losing their jobs and livelihoods,[15] and at least one person committed suicide due to this.[16] Her connections also affected her boyfriend, who never recovered.[12]

The second job was against the Loosduin County Savings Bank, a subsidiary of a large coporate conglomerate named Looskap, with ties to the Moralist International and massive, destructive economic influence over second world countries.[17] After the completion of her objectives, Klaasje feared that her employers would attempt to get rid of her, and fled instead of attending their rendezvous.[18] Using falsified documents that her employer had given her, with the name "Annouk Meijer-Smit", Klaasje took a flight to Revachol.[19] Her bags contained tickets for Villiers and then Casherbrume, on the Free State of Semenine, in order to hide at the edge of the Pale.[20]

Upon arriving, Klaasje booked a room in the Whirling-in-Rags and hid her documents inside a hollowed-out buoy, floating in the Martinaise Inlet. Then, she engaged in an intense regimen of partying, sex, drugs, booze, and karaoke. She amassed quite the collection of drugs, including NACRA (an opioid receptor antagonist for dealing with overdoses) and plenty of of Preptide, Saint Batiste's proprietary amphetamine. Her documents were later taken by the Insulindian Phasmid.[21] Despite her hiding, however, Klaasje continued to live in fear of persecution from both her employers and Looskap,[22] though neither would actually find her there.

Relationship With The Deceased
Instead, her presence attracted the attention of Iosef Lilianovich Dros, who watched her from his sniper's nest in the Sea Fortress, and developed a psychosexual obsession.

Provoked to kill by Klaasje and Lely's relationship, Dros shot and killed him through the window of her hostel room while the two were having sex. Fearing that the bullet was from a corporate assassin meant for her,[23] Klaasje set out to cover up the crime, manipulating Ruby and Titus Hardie into staging a hanging so that the RCM would investigate, believing it to be a murder tied to the ongoing strike.

She disguised her voice by nicking the telephone wire with a pair of nail scissors before calling in to report the supposed hanging[24] because she was afraid of the repercussions if it was discovered that she had phoned the RCM.

Interactions
Klaasje is the first character available to be interacted with, though passing by without talking to her on the first day may make a later Red Check easier. At first she is encountered while looking over Whirling's lower floor. In this first encounter, it is possible to roll for a Red Suggestion Check. Failure will prompt her to leave early without any further interrogation, while success will prompt a comment about the attraction being caused by heightened testosterone levels from the alcohol.[25] Removing the "Expression" beforehand will give a positive modifier for the check. She retreats into her room after Kim's initial introduction on the main floor.
She will mention Ostentatious Orchestrations, a disco group, and clue Harry in on his earlier exploits, including what he's meant to be doing in Martinaise.
Klaasje is made available for further questioning once the White Authority Check with Titus has been cleared, though it is recommended to have finished the field autopsy before she'll tell you what she knows about the night the hanged man died.
The choice to arrest Klaasje or let her go is given once all avenues for questioning are exhausted. If she is arrested, Kim will leave for the day to bring her in to the station, if not, she will assist with another key clue later on.
Pushing her far enough with a potential arrest will result in her betraying Ruby, giving enough details to press Titus with for her wherabouts.
Klaasje is available to talk until after the tribunal, if not arrested.

The name which is given to Klaasje, "Miss Oranje Disco Dancer", is a reference to Miss Europa Disco Dancer, a song by Manic Street Preachers.

Thank you for providing more information about the character Klaasje in Disco Elysium. Klaasje, also known as Miss Oranje Disco Dancer, is a character in the game who is originally from Oranje and has fled to Revachol after completing a job for her employer. She is known for her love of partying, drugs, and karaoke, and has a complicated relationship with Iosef Lilianovich Dros, who becomes obsessed with her and eventually kills her boyfriend, Lely. Klaasje works to cover up the crime and manipulate the investigation to protect herself from potential retribution from her employer or Looskap. In the game, players can interact with Klaasje and learn more about her past and motivations through conversation and skill checks.
